Sentencas: This paper represents a systematic approach to develop a virtual hydrogen sensor for predicting both the incidence and the extent of hydrogen starvation in high-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms

Sentencas: Fuel starvation would occur in a fuel cell when the fuel is consumed at a faster rate than is fed to the cell.
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms

Sentencas: A previously developed and validated pseudo-2D numerical model was used for finding the hydrogen distribution along the channels of a single cell of a high-temperature SOFC.
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms

Sentencas: Nine different input parameters of the model were changed and a dataset of nearly half a million operating points was generated using the fast and accurate pseudo-2D model.
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms

Sentencas: The dataset was randomly divided into the training set (70%) and the test set (30%).
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms

Sentencas: Four different binary classifiers including K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), Artificial Neural Network (ANN), Naive Bayes, and Logistic Regression were employed to determine if the cell operates in normal (0) or starved (1) at a given set of input parameters.
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms

Sentencas: It was found that KNN and ANN outperform the other methods with an F1-Score above 0.97 if the parameters are appropriately tuned.
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms

Sentencas: Another ANN was then trained using the starved data to estimate the percentage of the cell being starved with an accuracy of 97.5% based on the mean absolute error (MAE).
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms

Sentencas: Therefore, the proposed set of classifier-regressor can be successfully employed as a virtual hydrogen sensor for online tracking of hydrogen concentration along the cell.
Titulo: Developing a virtual hydrogen sensor for detecting fuel starvation in solid oxide fuel cells using different machine learning algorithms
